A zookeeper spotted 7 elephants when he entered the enclosure. To his surprise, a new arrival was added. How many elephants are there in the enclosure now?
Alexa has a collection of 7 pairs of silver earrings. She buys 11 more pairs from an online shop. After giving 2 pairs to her best friend, how many pairs of earrings does she end up with?
After a few days, she found 2 pairs of earrings that she previously misplaced. Adding those to her current collection, how many pairs of earrings does Alexa have now?

Suppose instead Alexa initially had 7 pairs of earrings, but this time she buys an additional 12 pairs online. After still giving 2 pairs to her friend, how many pairs of earrings would she have then?
A deck of cards has 8 suits: hearts and spades, plus 1 special suit. How many suits are there in total in the deck?
Suppose initially, the deck had 9 traditional suits in addition to the 1 special suit Arya found earlier. In this case, how many suits were there in the deck originally?
There are 8 lions at the zoo, but 7 have been moved to a different zoo. The number of tigers at the zoo is this new lion count plus 10. How many tigers are at the zoo?

Let's change the situation a bit. Suppose there were 8 lions at the zoo, but 7 of them were still moved to a different zoo. Instead of 10 tigers, this time there are 15 tigers at the zoo, accounting for the lions that were moved. How many tigers are there now at the zoo?
In a game, Max has a treasure chest with 10 gold coins. Later, he finds another set of coins that increase his total to 9 coins more than he had initially. How many gold coins does Max have now?
Max suddenly realizes that he has to pay 4 gold coins as a tax to the king of the game. How many gold coins will Max be left with after paying the tax?

Suppose that Max initially had 11 gold coins instead of 10 in his treasure chest before he found the additional set of coins. How many gold coins would Max have then after finding the additional coins?
Suzy has 6 pieces of candy. She then receives 1 more from her friend. How many pieces of candy does Suzy now have?

Following the previous situation, what if Suzy initially had 7 pieces of candy instead of 6, and then she receives 1 more from her friend just like before? How many pieces of candy would Suzy have then?
John has a collection of 17 books. He goes to the bookstore and buys 2 more books. How many books does John have in his library now?
After adding 2 new books to his library, John decides to give away 5 books as gifts to his friends. How many books does John have left in his library now?

In the original scenario, John started with 17 books, but what would have happened if he initially had only 2 books, and he still bought 2 more from the bookstore? How many books would John have had in his library then?
Mary originally has 20 dolls. She gives 6 of her dolls to her friend. How many dolls does Mary have now?
Continuing the scenario, imagine that initially Mary only had 9 dolls instead of 20. If she gave away 6 dolls to her friend as before, how many dolls would Mary have left?
Captain Jack had 3 parrots. Later, he found and added 6 more parrots to his crew. How many parrots does Captain Jack have in total?
If initially, Captain Jack had 14 parrots instead of 3, and he still found and added 6 more, how many parrots would he have in total then?
Liam has 8 piano keys to start with. Later in the day, he adds 3 more out of necessity. How many piano keys does Liam have now?
Following the additions earlier in the day, Liam decides to add 5 more piano keys to further expand his range. Now, how many piano keys does Liam have in total?

Following the earlier additions, let's consider a different scenario where Liam starts with 17 piano keys instead of the original 8. If he still adds 3 more keys as he did in the previous scenario, how many piano keys would Liam have now in this case?
A pack of lions consists of 10 female lions. The unique feature of a lion pack is that it allows 4 males, as well. How many lions are there in the pack in total?

Instead of originally having 10 female lions in the pack as mentioned in the first question, if there were 15 female lions and the 4 males still joined, how many lions would be there in the pack in total now?
A doctor come across 4 patients in the morning and later treats 10 more patients in the afternoon. How many patients did the doctor treat throughout the day?

After treating patients all day, the doctor still had other administrative tasks to complete. Initially, he had 19 tasks to finish, but he managed to complete the same number of tasks as the number of patients he treated. How many tasks does he still have left to complete?
Jenny has 7 balloons. She gave away 6 to her friends. How many balloons does she have left now?
Jenny heads back to the party and finds 10 more balloons. Including the balloons she already has, how many balloons does Jenny have now?
Suppose Jenny originally had 8 balloons instead of 7 before she gave away 6 to her friends. How many balloons would she have left after giving away the 6 balloons in that case?
Jimmy had 6 ice-creams and then he bought 5 more. Later, he was given 3 more ice-creams. How many ice-creams does Jimmy have now?
Following the previous scenario, Jimmy later wins a contest where he receives 5 additional ice-creams. How many ice-creams does Jimmy have now?

Following the previous scenario, what if Jimmy initially had 9 ice-creams instead of 5 and then following the same events, bought 6 more and was given 3 more, how many ice-creams would Jimmy have then?
An album has 15 songs in total, but Sam already listened to 9 of them. How many songs on the album has Sam not listened to yet?

After realizing that Sam has not listened to some of the songs on the album, his friend Alex decided to share 3 additional new songs with him. Now, how many songs in total has Sam not listened to yet?

In the previous problem, we learned that Sam had initially not listened to some songs and Alex shared 3 additional songs with him. However, what if Sam had originally listened to 13 songs from the album instead of 9, how many songs from the album then would he have not listened to?
A wizard casts a spell that creates 12 magical orbs. Then, he performs another spell and conjures 8 more orbs. How many magical orbs does the wizard have in total?
After conjuring up the orbs, the wizard decides to use 2 of the orbs to power his magic staff. How many magical orbs does he have left now?

Let's consider a change. Instead of creating 12 magical orbs initially, the wizard had only conjured up 10 orbs. Then, he performed another spell and made 8 more orbs. How many magical orbs would the wizard have in total in this case?
A young dinosaur enthusiast has 13 dinosaur figurines. He decides to give 8 of them to his best friend. How many dinosaur figurines is he left with?
After a thoughtful night, the young dinosaur enthusiast decides to give one more of his dinosaur figurines to his best friend. How many dinosaur figurines does he have left then?
What if initially, the young dinosaur enthusiast had given 6 of his dinosaur figurines to his best friend instead of 8? How many dinosaur figurines would he have left then?
Maya has 20 total beads. She uses 6 beads to make her first bracelet. How many beads are left to use for her next bracelet?
After making that first bracelet, Maya uses all the remaining beads to make a second bracelet. If that second bracelet needs 18 beads in total, how many more beads does Maya need to complete it?
What if Maya initially had 9 beads instead of 6 when she started making her first bracelet? How many beads would she have left to use for her next bracelet?
A doctor starts her day with 15 patients. She successfully attends to 9 of these patients in the morning. How many patients does she still need to attend to?

After checking her schedule again, the doctor realizes that there were actually 16 patients to start with, not 15. After attending to 9 of these patients in the morning, how many patients does she now have left to attend to?
John has 11 blue pens and 5 red pens. How many pens does John have in total?

Farmer Bob harvested 7 potatoes from his garden in the morning. In the afternoon, he found an additional 9 potatoes. However, he realised he had to give 10 of his harvested potatoes to his neighbour as part of an agreement. How many potatoes did Farmer Bob have left?
After giving his neighbour the agreed-upon potatoes, Farmer Bob found another patch of potatoes in his garden and harvested 14 more. How many potatoes does he have now?

Suppose Farmer Bob originally harvested 7 potatoes in the morning and then found 4 more in the afternoon, instead of the 9 he originally found. After giving his neighbour 10 potatoes, how many potatoes would he have then?
Alexa baked a cake full of 15 cherries. Then, she ate 6 cherries from the cake. Later, she decided to add 8 more cherries to the cake. How many cherries are there now on the cake?
After putting on the additional cherries, Alexa decided the cake looked a little bare, so she added 2 more cherries. How many cherries are now on the cake in total?
In our previous scenario, Alexa started with 9 cherries on her cake instead of 15. After eating 6 cherries and then adding 8 more, how many cherries would be on the cake?
There are 3 small trees and 6 medium trees in a park. How many trees will be there if 9 additional big trees are planted?
In the previous scenario, what if instead of planting 9 big trees, we had only planted 8 big trees? How many trees would there be in the park then?
John has 7 glasses on a shelf. He goes to the store and buys 3 more glasses. How many glasses does he have now?
Imagine if instead of 7 glasses, John originally had 12 glasses on the shelf along with the 7 he bought from the store. How many glasses would John have then?
A zookeeper has 2 lions in one section of the zoo and 8 lions in a separate section. How many lions does the zookeeper have in total?
After the count, two more lions are transferred from another zoo to the zookeeper's sections. Now, how many lions does the zookeeper have in total?

What if instead of the initial count, the zookeeper had 12 lions in the first section and 8 lions in the second section before the new arrivals? How many lions would the zookeeper have then, before the two new lions arrived?
A team of 9 firefighters was sent to extinguish a fire. 6 firefighters managed to get to the site immediately. How many firefighters are still on their way?
After 5 additional firefighters from another station were dispatched, how many firefighters are on their way now?
Suppose the team initially consisted of 11 firefighters instead of 9. In that case, how many firefighters would still be on their way if 6 managed to get to the site immediately?
Carter wants to swing 6 times on the blue swing. After that, he wants to swing 12 more times on the red swing. How many times does Carter want to swing in total?

Instead of wanting to swing 6 times on the blue swing and 12 times on the red swing, Carter changes his mind and decides he wants to swing 6 times on both the blue and red swing. How many times does Carter now want to swing in total?
There are 5 rooms on the ground floor of a house. If the total number of rooms in the house is 18, how many rooms are there above the ground floor?
Not only that, but there is also a basement to consider. If we count the basement as a room, how many rooms in the house are there above the ground floor or in the basement?
Sara blows 1 bubble. Then, she doubles the number of bubbles she just blew. How many bubbles did she blow in the second attempt?

Instead of blowing 1 bubble on her first attempt, suppose Sara blew 5 bubbles. If she doubled the number of bubbles from this new first attempt on her second attempt, how many bubbles would she have blown in the second attempt?
Carlos has 6 strings for his kites. Some one gives him 11 more strings. How many strings does Carlos have in total for his kites?
In the previous scenario, Carlos initially had 6 kite strings. But what if instead he was given 14 more strings instead of 11? How many kite strings would he have in total then?
Mark has written 3 letters to his parents and an additional 8 letters to his friends. How many letters has Mark written in total?
After writing all his previous letters, Mark remembers one more friend to whom he wishes to write. After including this letter, how many letters has Mark written in total?
Suppose originally, Mark only wrote 3 letters to his parents instead of 5 and still wrote 2 letters to his friends. How many letters would he have written in total then?
Tina has 1 apple and she finds 8 more apples under the apple tree. How many apples does she have altogether?
Tina eats 8 of the apples she has collected. How many apples does she have left now?
Instead of finding 8 more apples, what would have been the total number of apples Tina had if she only found 6 more under the apple tree?

At the zoo, we spotted 6 giraffes in one area, but 4 wandered off to another part of the habitat. A little later, an additional 11 giraffes came over from a neighboring enclosure. How many giraffes are now in this part of the habitat?
Sam has 18 chocolate candies. He eats 16 of them while watching a movie. How many chocolates does he have left?
After watching the movie, Sam's brother gives him 16 more chocolate candies. How many chocolates does Sam have now?
What if Sam initially had 18 chocolate candies but only ate 6 while watching the movie? How many chocolates would he have left in this case?
John bought 9 shirts last week but gave 6 shirts away to his friends. How many shirts does John have left now?
After realizing he gave away too many, John decided to buy 13 more shirts. How many shirts does John have now in total?

John originally thought he had bought 17 shirts last week, but then he remembered he only bought 6 before giving some away to his friends. How many shirts would John have left if he actually started with 17 shirts?
Peter had 16 carrots altogether. But then he gave 2 carrots to his pet rabbit, how many carrots does he have left now?
Peter then notices that he needs 15 carrots to make his carrot soup recipe. How many more carrots does he need to be able to make the soup?
Now imagine if Peter had given 10 carrots to his pet rabbit instead of just 2. How many carrots would he have left then?
A local shop opens at 13.00 hour. Five hours later, what will be the time on the clock?
The local shop usually closes one hour before the time it is supposed to. At what time will the shop actually close after it opens at 13.00 hour and is supposed to stay open for 5 hours?
Gary has a total of 16 pairs of pants in his wardrobe. Later, he buys a new pair on his shopping trip. How many pairs of pants does he have now?
Janet has 8 crayons, and gives 3 of them to her friend, Anna. How many crayons does Janet have left now?
Janet finds 2 more crayons in her bag after giving some to Anna. How many crayons does she have in total now?
Let's say initially, Janet had 14 crayons instead of 8 before she gave 3 of them to her friend, Anna. How many crayons would she have had left in this case?
A rabbit found 5 carrots in the backyard and one more in the front yard. How many carrots in total did the rabbit find?
After finding those carrots, the rabbit finds one more carrot in the neighbor's yard. How many total carrots has the rabbit found now?
If originally the rabbit found 17 carrots in the backyard instead of 5, and still found one in the front yard, how many total carrots would the rabbit have found?
Emma is on a plane that is flying 9 hours to reach her layover. After a short rest, she will then fly for another 3 hours to reach her final destination. How long is her total flying time?
An alien has 3 eyes on one side of its head and 5 on the other. How many total eyes does the alien have?
Let's revisit our previous question. What if the first alien only had 3 eyes on one side of its head, but still had 8 eyes on the other side. How many total eyes does this alien have now?
A circus has 14 clowns, but 7 plus 3 of them decide to leave the circus. How many clowns are left at the circus?
Suppose initially, instead of 7 clowns leaving the circus, only 3 plus 3 clowns decided to leave. Then how many clowns would have been left at the circus?
Melissa has 5 blankets in her living room. She finds 14 more stashed away in her wardrobe. How many blankets does she have in total?
After counting all the blankets, Melissa decides to donate 6 of them to a local shelter. How many blankets does she have left after her kind donation?
Suppose Melissa initially had 9 blankets in her wardrobe instead of 14. How many blankets would she have in total then?
A geometry box contains 18 shapes. If one shape is removed, how many shapes are left in the box?
After removing one shape, there are still too many shapes left in the geometry box. Arya decides to remove 8 more shapes. How many shapes would be left in the geometry box then?
Charlie has 11 scooters in his collection. He then adds one more to it by purchasing the latest model. How many scooters does Charlie have now?
After realizing his collection is getting too big, Charlie decides to sell some of his scooters. If he sells 6 of them, how many scooters does he have left?
Instead of having initially 11 scooters, what if Charlie started with only 4 scooters in his collection and then added one more? How many scooters would Charlie have now?
In the morning, Alex saw 6 dinosaurs near his campsite, and in the afternoon he saw 4 more. How many dinosaurs did Alex see in total?
Initially, Alex saw 15 dinosaurs in the morning instead of 6. After adding the 4 he saw in the afternoon, how many dinosaurs did then Alex see before the evening?
A baby Tyrannosaurus Rex had 3 teeth when it was born. Every week, the baby T-Rex grows 3 more teeth. How many teeth does the T-Rex have after one week?

The baby Tyrannosaurus Rex with its new teeth was curious about the adult Tyrannosaurs. It learned that, on average, an adult T-Rex has 11 teeth. After growing its new teeth, how many more teeth does the baby T-Rex need to grow to have as many teeth as an adult T-Rex?

Suppose instead of the baby T-Rex having 3 teeth to start with, it only had 1 tooth when it was born. If it still grows 3 additional teeth each week, how many teeth will the baby T-Rex have after one week?
David has 15 beach balls. He buys 4 more from a beach toy store. How many beach balls does David have in total now?
In addition to his collection, David gave 3 of his beach balls to his friends. How many beach balls does he have left now?
Suppose initially, instead of 15, David had 11 beach balls. If he then buys 4 more from the store, how many beach balls would David have in total in this new scenario?

A sock company packages their socks in sets of 40. They have 2840 socks to package, and they currently have 93 packs already made. How many packs of socks will they have in total once all the socks have been packaged? Afterward, they received an another shipment of 70 packs of socks, but had to return 8 due to quality issues. How many packs of socks does the company have now?
A gardener has a field where he planted 80 rose bushes, with each bush producing 30 roses. Before he is able to gather them, a storm blows away 43 roses. How many roses are remaining in the field?

The gardener realizes afterwards that he initially miscounted the rose bushes in the field. It turns out there were not 80, but 84 rose bushes instead, each still producing 30 roses, and the storm still managed to blow away 43 roses. How many roses does he actually have remaining in the field after the correction?
A dolphin can leap (3 + 59) feet high. If a dolphin completes 89 jumps in a day, how many feet in total has the dolphin jumped in that day?

Continuing from the original scenario, suppose we made a mistake in our measurements and realized that the dolphin, in fact, can leap (41 + 59) feet high instead of (3 + 59) feet. Considering this, if the dolphin still completes 89 jumps in a day, how many feet in total has the dolphin jumped in that day now?
A candy store starts the day with 81 pieces of candy. They receive a delivery adding another 6 candies, but they sell 61 throughout the day. How many pieces of candy does the store have left?

Continuing from the original scenario, suppose the candy store started the day with 81 pieces of candy and received a delivery adding 6, but this time, they only sold 7 candies throughout the day. How many pieces of candy does the store now have left?
A sports store received a huge shipment of 6806 pairs of ice skates. If they evenly distribute the skates over 82 separate stores, how many pairs of ice skates does each store receive?

A sports store received a huge shipment of 6806 pairs of ice skates. After reconsideration, they decided to distribute the skates over 61 stores instead of the original 82. How many pairs of ice skates does each store receive now?
If a stationery store has 40 white erasers and 74 pink erasers, how many erasers are there in total?
Suppose instead that the stationery store had 40 white erasers and 37 pink erasers initially. How many erasers would be there in total in that case?
A company manufactures a batch of pens, with each batch containing 39 pens. If the company has produced 10 such batches, how many pens does the company have now?

The company found an error in their manufacturing record and realized they actually produced 43 batches of pens, not 10. Each batch still contained 39 pens. How many pens did the company actually produce?
A dairy farm has 33 cows. Each cow gives (99 + 58) litres of milk per day. How many litres of milk does the farm produce in a day?

Suppose that instead of each cow producing (99 + 58) litres of milk per day as previously stated, they actually produce only (5 + 58) litres of milk daily. How many litres of milk would the farm produce from cows in this case?
A farmer's grape vine produces 3344 grapes, and he has 38 equally productive grape vines. How many grapes does each vine produce?

In the original scenario, a grape vine produces 3344 grapes and the farmer has 38 equally productive grape vines. Now consider a new situation. Let's say the farmer had 75 equally productive vines instead of 38. How many grapes would each vine have produced now?
Yesterday, a region experienced a heavy snowfall of 93 cm and today it received additional 29 cm of snow. However, 20 cm of snow has melted. How much snow is now left?

Considering the previous problem, suppose the region experienced a heavier snowfall of 90 cm (instead of 29 cm) today, while the 20 cm melt remained the same. How might this change the amount of snow now left?

A farmer has 3069 grapes. If he decides to put 33 grapes in each bag, he will have a certain number of bags. However, the farmer eats 13 bags of grapes and also gives away 50 bags of grapes. How many bags of grapes does the farmer have left?

Following the previous scenario, suppose the farmer decides to change his approach and now puts 25 grapes in each bag instead of 33. He again eats 13 bags and gives away 50 bags. How many bags of grapes does the farmer have now?
A giraffe's neck has a length of 275 centimeters. If one meter is made up of 5 centimeters, what is the length of the giraffe's neck in meters?

After measuring the giraffe's neck in meters, the zookeeper re-evaluates and discovers that his conversion tool was using an incorrect scale, where one meter actually equals 43 centimeters, not 5 centimeters. Given this new information, what is the length of the giraffe's neck in meters?
A furniture store had 79 chairs in stock. They received a shipment adding 9 more chairs, but then sold 45 chairs in a single day. How many chairs are now in the store?

Following from the previous scenario, consider instead that the furniture store originally had 79 chairs, but this time, they only received a shipment adding 4 more chairs before selling 45 chairs in a single day. How many chairs are now in the store under this altered situation?

A teddy bear factory can usually produce 91 teddy bears per day. However, today their capacity increased by 1 due to new equipment. A charity has also just donated materials to produce 15 additional teddy bears. How many total teddy bears can the factory produce today?
A giraffe needs 67 leaves to eat at breakfast and 33 more in the afternoon. How many leaves does the giraffe need for a single day?
If you can drive 304 miles on a tank of gas and the tank is divided into 4 equal parts, how many miles can you drive on one part of the tank?

If you can drive 304 miles on a full tank of gas which is divided into 4 equal parts, you've found that you can drive a certain distance on one part of the tank. If you refill this part of the tank 47 times, how many miles in total could you potentially drive?

A superhero needs to rescue people from two locations. He needs to travel 56.6 miles to reach the first location and an additional 29.15 miles to reach the second location. How many miles does the superhero need to travel in total to reach both locations?

The previous scenario mentioned that the superhero needs to travel 56.6 miles to reach the first location and then an additional 29.15 miles to reach the second location. However, suppose there is a new scenario where the distance to the second location is increased to 87 miles instead of 29.15 miles while the distance to first location remains the same. How many miles does the superhero need to travel in total to reach both locations in this new scenario?
A princess possesses 3054.4 precious gems which she wants to equally distribute amongst her 33.2 loyal knights. How many precious gems does each knight receive?

Suppose the princess made another mistake and actually had to distribute the same total number of 3054.4 precious gems amongst not 33.2, but 76 knights instead. How many precious gems does each knight now receive?
A jeweler uses 27.2 grams of gold to make each ring. If the jeweler plans to make 89.73 rings, how many grams of gold will be needed in total?

The jeweler decides to make another batch of rings identical to the first. If the jeweler uses 27.2 grams of gold for each ring and makes 89.73 rings in each batch, how many grams of gold will be needed in total for both batches?

In a revision to their plans, the jeweler decides to reduce the number of rings in the first batch to 51 rings instead of 89.73. If the jeweler uses 27.2 grams of gold for each ring, how many grams of gold would now be needed for the revised first batch?
A specific species of shark usually grows 3.2 feet longer each year. If a certain shark of this species has been alive for 89.57 years, how much total length has it gained since it was born?

After growing for 89.57 years, the shark was caught and had an additional 76.48 feet of length added by attaching a long tracking device. What is the total length of the shark now including the tracking device?
Suppose instead of growing 3.2 feet every year, the shark grew 19 feet each year. How much total length would the shark have gained after 89.57 years under this new growth rate?

In a playful snowball fight, Jason threw a snowball that went 50.23 meters before hitting the ground. However, it first had to travel past a tree that was 24.6 meters away. How much distance did the snowball cover past the tree before it hit the ground?
After hitting the ground, the snowball rolled an additional 4.4 meters. What was the total distance that the snowball travelled from Jason's hand to its final stopping point?

Jason decided to have another snowball fight but this time the snowball went 78 meters before hitting the ground, still having to travel past the same tree that was 24.6 meters away. How much distance did the snowball cover past the tree before it hit the ground this time?
A beach ball manufacturer produces 3792.28 beach balls which are distributed equally amongst 45.2 beach stores. How many beach balls does each store receive?
If each of the beach stores received an additional shipment of beach balls equal to the amount they originally received, how many beach balls does each store now have in total?

If the beach ball manufacturer had initially produced 3792.28 beach balls which were distributed equally amongst 48 beach stores instead of 45.2, how many beach balls would each store have received originally?
A fishing company has caught 1303.12 pounds of fish, which they want to divide equally among 18.2 of their stores. How many pounds of fish will each store receive?

Following the last question, suppose the fishing company initially caught 35 pounds of fish instead of 1303.12 pounds and it still had to be divided equally among 18.2 stores. How many pounds of fish will each store receive now?
A luxurious watch brand has two different models. The first model weighs 68.7 grams, and the second one weighs 49.3 grams. What is the total weight of both watch models in grams?

Following the previous question: If an artist decides to decorate each gram of both watch models with 75.6 milligrams of gold, how many milligrams of gold will he need in total to decorate all the watches?
Following the previous question: If the first watch model actually weighed 68.7 grams and a second, lighter model only weighed 1 gram, what would be the total weight of both watch models in grams?
A snowman is built with a large base snowball that weighs 42.8 pounds and a smaller top snowball that weighs 6.3 pounds. How much does the snowman weigh in total?
Given the total weight of the previously built snowman, an even larger snowman is to be made that is 91.92 times heavier than the first. How heavy is this new snowman?

Previously, a snowman was built with a base snowball that weighed 42.8 pounds and a top snowball that weighed 6.3 pounds. Now, consider a scenario where the top snowball is much larger and weighs 51 pounds instead. How much does the snowman weigh in this case?
A factory produced 24.91 pencils per minute for a consecutive period of 46.98 minutes. How many pencils were produced in total?

Following the previous scenario, suppose the factory changed its production rate and now can only produce 11 pencils per minute. If the factory ran for 46.98 minutes at this new rate, how many pencils were produced in total?
A farmer has 26.0 chickens, each laying 22.0 eggs. How many eggs in total do the chickens lay?
The farmer decides to sell the eggs in the market. Each egg sells for $10.11. How much money in total does the farmer earn from the sale of the eggs?
In a new scenario, the farmer has 26.0 chickens, but now, each chicken lays 49 eggs instead of 22. How many eggs in total do the chickens lay in this scenario?
A bus consumes 18.5 liters of fuel per trip. If the bus completes 62.38 trips, how many liters of fuel will it have consumed in total?
After the bus completes 62.38 trips and consumes certain amount of fuel, it is refueled with an additional 42.5 liters. What is the total amount of fuel that the bus has after it is refueled?
If the bus consumes 50 liters of fuel per trip instead of 18.5 liters, and it still completes 62.38 trips, how many liters of fuel will it have consumed in total?
A jacket costs $14.97 and a person wants to buy 5.9 jackets. What will be the total cost of the jackets?

Following on from the previous situation: If instead of wanting to buy 5.9 jackets, the person wanted to buy 62 jackets at the original price of $14.97 each, what would be the total cost for these jackets?
A bookstore initially has 74.46 books. After selling some of them, only 52.19 books are left. How many books did the bookstore sell?

Given the same situation, suppose initially the bookstore actually had 74.46 books and they sold some books to a point where their stock was reduced to 57 books. How many books did the bookstore sell in this case?
A chair production company produces 95.0 chairs every day. If each chair uses 20.7 kilograms of wood, how many kilograms of wood does the company use in one day?
Following up on the previous question, if the chair company managed to save 98.83 kilograms of wood after a day's production, how many kilograms of wood did they actually use in making the chairs?

Following up on the original question, suppose the chair production company instead produces 32 chairs per day, still using the same 20.7 kilograms of wood per chair. How many kilograms of wood does the company use in this case?
A jeweler is creating a ring that combines two metals. The first metal weighs 63.2 grams and the second metal weighs 62.95 grams. How much will the ring weigh in grams when both metals are combined?

After creating the ring that combines two metals weighing 63.2 grams and 62.95 grams respectively, the jeweler decides to remove 41.42 grams of the material for fine-tuning the design. What would be the new weight of the ring in grams after this removal?

In a modified design, the jeweler decides to use a different first metal that weighs 26 grams instead of 63.2 grams but keeps the second metal that weighs 62.95 grams. In this modified design, what will the new total weight of the ring be with the two metals combined?

A star is 3480.66 light years away from Earth. If the star's light is seen from 36.6 different sighting points on Earth, what is the average distance in light years of the star from each sighting point?
A pizza place sold 84.3 pepperoni pizzas today. They also sold 47.9 more mushroom pizzas. How many pizzas did they sell in total today?
In addition to the pizzas sold previously, the pizza place also sold 95.5 margherita pizzas today. Altogether, how many pizzas did they sell today?

A castle has a height of 68.4 meters. If a scale model of this castle is made where 1 meter of the original castle corresponds to 27.69 mm of the model, how many millimeters tall will the model of the castle be?
If the scale model is then placed on a 64.84 mm pedestal, what will be the total height in millimeters of the castle model including the pedestal?
If instead of corresponding to 27.69 mm, 1 meter of the original castle corresponded to 29 mm on the model, how many millimeters tall would the model of the castle be then?
A wizard has a collection of 17.7 magical ingredients. Recently, he found another spot that contained 34.1 magical items. How many magical ingredients does the wizard have in total now?
In the previous scenario, what if the wizard initially had only 17.7 magical items and he found a new spot that contained 83 magical items? How many magical items would the wizard have in total then?
A fleet of camping tents has a combined weight of 1448.37 pounds. If there are 69.3 tents in this fleet, how much does each tent weigh in pounds?

Following up on the previous question, the standard weight for this type of tent is set at 85.4 pounds. After working out the actual weight of each tent, how much do the tents differ from the standard weight?
Following up on the previous question, what if there were actually 45 tents in the fleet instead of 69.3? With the same total weight of 1448.37 pounds, how much would each tent weigh then?
A monkey collected 52.7 bananas in the morning and 88.17 bananas in the afternoon. How many bananas did the monkey collect in total?
Each bubble has a volume of 55.9 cubic centimeters. If a child blows 77.8 such bubbles, what would be the total volume of the bubbles in cubic centimeters?

Suppose instead of each bubble having a volume of 55.9 cubic centimeters, each one had a volume of 56 cubic centimeters. If the child still blows 77.8 bubbles, what would then be the total volume of all the bubbles in cubic centimeters?
A dinosaur eats 19.45 kilograms of vegetation every hour. If it eats for 48.71 hours straight without stopping, how many kilograms of vegetation will it have consumed in total?

In addition to its usual diet, the same dinosaur decided to try a new type of plant and managed to consume 97.01 kilograms of this new vegetation. How many kilograms of vegetation in total did the dinosaur eat, including both the regular and the new plant?
Instead of eating for 48.71 hours, let's say the dinosaur only ate its usual diet of vegetation for 20 hours. How many kilograms of vegetation would the dinosaur have consumed then?
A dragon has hoarded 65.4 kilograms of gold and 28.5 kilograms of gems. How much total weight has the dragon hoarded in kilograms?

After the dragon has hoarded 65.4 kilograms of gold and 28.5 kilograms of gems, he decides to add some silver to his hoard. If the dragon's total hoard is decreased by 6.74 kilograms after adding the silver, what will be the new total weight of the dragon's hoard?
Each teddy bear in a toy shop weighs 96.8 grams. If there are 93.3 teddy bears in the shop, what is the total weight of the teddy bears in grams?

After calculating the total weight of the teddy bears, the toy shop receives a new shipment of teddy bears weighing a total of 74.6 grams. What is the new total weight of all the teddy bears in the shop?
After rechecking, it turns out that there are only 10 teddy bears in the toy shop, not 93.3. Each teddy bear still weighs 96.8 grams. What is the total weight of the 10 teddy bears?
A UFO is found to travel 2.46 light years every month. How far, in light years, would the UFO have travelled after 3.5 months?

Following from the previous scenario, after travelling 2.46 light years every month for 3.5 months, the UFO then continued travelling for an additional 33.17 light years. How far did the UFO travel in total?

In the previous situation, the UFO was assumed to travel 2.46 light years every month for 3.5 months. Now assume that the UFO has instead been traveling at that speed for 68 months. How far in light years would the UFO have traveled this time?
In a park, there is a rectangular field with an area of 36.82 square meters. If there are 57.5 such fields in the park, what is the total area, in square meters, of all these fields?

In the park scenario from earlier, suppose the park's management wants to reduce the number of fields to 34, but each field still has an area of 36.82 square meters. What would be the total area, in square meters, of all these fields in the park then?
A herd of giraffes collectively eats 2571.29 kilograms of leaves each day. If there are 38.9 giraffes in the herd, how many kilograms of leaves does each giraffe eat daily?

Following on from the previous problem, suppose the number of giraffes in the herd were halved to 19 instead of 38.9. Assuming the same total amount of leaf consumption as before (2571.29 kilograms), how many kilograms of leaves would each giraffe in this smaller herd consume daily?
A unicorn needs 217.35 units of magic energy to teleport to another location. If one rainbow provides 20.7 units of magic energy, how many rainbows will it consume for the unicorn to teleport once?

In the previous problem, a unicorn needed 217.35 units of magic energy to teleport to another location and then recover. But what if a smaller, younger unicorn only needs 83 units of magic energy to teleport? How many rainbows would this younger unicorn consume for just the teleportation part?

A ballerina has 3 green tutus. She needs to have 10 in total for an upcoming series of performances. How many more tutus does she need to get?

The school bus stops to pick up students. Initially, it has 10 students on board. After picking up some more students, there are 12 students in total on the bus. How many students did the bus pick up?

A butterfly starts her day with 6 flowers and visits r more in the afternoon to get her total daily quota of 10 flowers. How many more flowers does she need to visit in the afternoon?

Carla has a garden and wants to calculate the amount of cucumbers she will be able to grow. King Arthur is calculating the costs for restoring his castle. The wall repairs cost 26/22 of his castle's annual budget. Meanwhile, the moat renovations cost an additional 4/29 of the budget. Finally, installing new defensive catapults takes up an 11/3 portion of the budget. How much (expressed as a fraction of the castle's annual budget) has King Arthur spent on these projects in total?

A giraffe at the local zoo has a peculiar eating habit. When it is fed 25/19 lbs of acacia leaves, it eats 30/26 times more than what it usually does in a day. If the zoo calculates the weekly feeding amount by multiplying the daily intake by itself (making the result "weekly feeding amount squared") and then multiplying that with the regular daily intake, how many pounds of acacia leaves should they prepare for the giraffe for a week? Calculate ((25 / 19) * (30 / 26))^2 * ((25 / 19) * (30 / 26)) and provide your answer.

Continuing from the previous scenario, the zookeepers found an additional giraffe with the same peculiar eating habits. They decided to combine the weekly feeding amounts for both giraffes. If the feeding amount for each giraffe for the week is calculated as in the previous problem ((25 / 19) * (30 / 26))^2 * ((25 / 19) * (30 / 26)), what would be the total amount of acacia leaves the zoo should prepare to feed both giraffes for a week? Calculate (y + y) where y is the weekly feeding amount for one giraffe.

In continuation of the old scenario, now imagine that the same giraffe's diet has changed slightly. Instead of eating 30/26 times more than its usual intake, it now eats 27/26 times more. So now, with these changes, how much acacia leaves should the zookeepers prepare for a week? Calculate ((25 / 19) * (27 / 26))^2 * ((25 / 19) * (27 / 26)) to estimate the total amount of food needed.

Lara wants to make a necklace. The necklace requires (11/3) feet of yarn. She also wants to add smaller beads which will extend the length of the necklace by (8/30) feet. How many feet of materials will Lara need to make the necklace?

Two planes depart from an airport at the exact same time. Plane A is flying at a speed of 24/11 miles per minute and Plane B is flying at a speed of 26/27 miles per minute. How much farther (in miles) did Plane A travel than Plane B after exactly one minute, assuming they keep flying at a stable speed? Imagine if instead of eating 14/7 pounds of fish per day, the adult bear actually eats 22/7 pounds of fish per day. Recalculate the total combined daily amount of fish the adult and young bear eat by multiplying 22/7 and 25/13.

Toby plays guitar. His first song takes 12/8 hours to play and his second song takes 12/3 hours to play. How long does it take Toby to play both of his songs? Write your answer as a simplified fraction.

Suppose you have 28 out of 29 chocolate bars. Then, you found 8 out of 22 more chocolate bars. What fraction represents the total chocolate bars you have now?

If the maker is trying to produce two identical needles, how much material will he require?

Sophia has 17/20 of a dollar. Her friend gives her another 1/4 of a dollar. After some time, her brother gives her 1 dollar. How much money does Sophia have now in dollars?

Suppose instead of having 17/20 of a dollar originally, Sophia actually had 17/19 of a dollar. Then her friend gave her another 1/4 of a dollar, and her brother gave her 1 dollar. How much money does she have now in total?

Imagine you're a music producer who is working on a new song. Your resources are divided into different sections.

- First, you dedicate 16/4 hours to composing the music and another 16/29 hours to writing the lyrics. This is your initial time investment for the song (let's call it p).

- Then, you spend 28/13 hours for mixing and mastering the song in addition to the initial time investment (let's call this new total time b).

- Suddenly, a drummer you hired for a session uses 18/4 hours less because he finished his parts quickly.

What is the final time you spent on producing the song, if your total time is expressed as (b - (18 / 4))?

Let's revisit the music production scenario, but this time with a minor difference.

- To begin, you allocate 16/4 hours to create the melodies and a larger chunk of your time, 16/1 hours, to pen the lyrics. This forms your initial time investment (p) in the song.

- Afterwards, you spend an additional 28/13 hours on mixing and mastering the track, in conjunction with your initial time (Let's call this newly computed total time b).

- However, your drummer who was initially scheduled for a certain number of hours finishes faster, using up 18/4 hours less than planned.

Given these adjustments, what will be the new total footage of your song, if the final time is computed as (b - (18 / 4))?

Princess Lily was dining at a finely set table and in front of her, two dishes were placed, one with slices of apple pie and the other with slices of blueberry pie. She can eat pie slices endlessly! Marta has a box of colored pencils. She uses 20 of the colored pencils every 11 days on her art projects. However, she only uses about 23 out of every 26 colored pencils for shading techniques. How many colored pencils does Marta use for shading in her art projects over an 11-day period? To find this, you need to add the fraction of colored pencils she uses from the previous problem to the amount of metallic pencils she uses. Evaluate this by performing the operation (8 / 6) + ((20 / 11) * (23 / 26)) and write your answer as a simplified fraction.

Marta realized that she actually only uses 23 out of 24 colored pencils for shading techniques, not 23 out of 26 as previously mentioned. Now, how many colored pencils does Marta use for shading in her art projects over an 11-day period?

A police investigator is analyzing two evidence specimens. The first specimen has a unique property that decreases its value by 26 out of every 6 units. The second specimen decreases its value by 25 out of every 17 units. The investigator needs to find the ratio of these changes, referred to as indicator i.

Additionally, he needs to figure out a set of changes in another pair of evidence specimens. The first one of this pair increases its value by 18 out of every 8 units and the second one increases its value by 17 out of every 23 units. The investigator has to find the difference between these two rates and refer to it as indicator h.

He then combines these two indicators (h and i) by multiplying them to get a final evidence factor, referred to as indicator f. This will help determine the likelihood of a particular suspect’s involvement. Calculate the value of f.

In a wildlife park, there are lions and giraffes. During one particular year, the gestation period of a lioness is represented as 20/22 of a year, while a giraffe's gestation period is 15 years. Find the total gestation period of both animals together. 

Later in the same year, a lioness is pregnant again but this time her gestation period reduces by 15/20 of a year compared to the earlier total gestation period of both animals. How long will it take for the lioness to give birth this second time?

A rectangle's length is 30/7 meters and its width is 19/6 meters. The area of the rectangle is found by multiplying the length and the width. If a similar rectangle has an area which is 18/17 times bigger than the original rectangle, what is the area of the similar rectangle?

A similar rectangle has an area which is 18/17 times larger than the original rectangle. If we subtract 19/2 square meters from the area of the similar rectangle, what is the remaining area?

A soap factory produces 23/8 tonnes of soap each day. One day, they decided to increase production by an extra 4/20 of a tonne. You have a paint mixing machine that creates specific shades of color.

The machine starts by mixing 24/8 gallons of red paint. It then pours away 12/8 gallons of the mix. Let 'd' represent the amount of red paint left in the machine.

Finally, the machine adds another 1/28 gallon of blue pigment to lighten the color, subtract that from 'd' to find 'x' in gallons, which is the total amount of paint. Find the value of 'x'.

Subtract this newer amount of blue pigment from 'd' to find 'x' in gallons, which is the total amount of paint. What is the value of 'x' now?

A banana bread recipe requires you to multiply the fractions (27 / 14) and (17 / 13) together to determine how many ounces of mashed bananas you'll need. Compute the product of these fractions and write your answer as a simplified fraction to find out how many ounces are required.

After finding out how many ounces of mashed bananas you'll need for the banana bread, you realize that you need to scale up the recipe by the factor represented by the fraction (8 / 4). Compute the product of the original fraction and the scaling factor (8 / 4) to determine the new amount of mashed bananas that will be needed. Write your answer as a simplified fraction.
