James has a toy car collection. He noticed that when he counts his collection, he gets a total of 12 cars. If each type of car he has comes in pairs, how many types of toy cars does James have?
A sailor has several identical boats. If all of his boats are out in the water, there are 8 boats sailing in total. If each boat comes in pairs, how many pairs of boats does the sailor own?
A farmer harvested 6 kilograms of tomatoes from his farm. If every basket he uses can carry 2 kilograms of tomatoes, how many baskets does he need to pack all his tomatoes?

A police officer notices that every car parked in the no-parking zone receives a ticket. If there are 6 cars parked in the no-parking zone and each is given one ticket, how many tickets does the officer distribute?
The distance between two points on the moon is 96 miles. If each small sector of the moon covers 8 miles, then how many sectors are there between these two points?
A vineyard worker has been assigned to pick grapes from a certain number of plants. He picks 24 bunches of grapes after picking from 4 plants. How many bunches of grapes does he pick from each plant?
A building has 120 square feet of window space. If each window takes up 10 square feet, how many windows are on the building?
At a beach party, there are 55 beach balls available for guests to play with. If each color of beach ball is present in groups of 5, how many different colors of beach balls are there?
A pirate finds a chest full of gold doubloons. If each doubloon weighs 9 grams and the total weight of all his doubloons is 90 grams, how many doubloons has the pirate found?
A student has a total of 18 erasers. If he puts them into 6 equally-sized boxes, how many erasers would each box contain?
A beader has 36 beads for making bracelets. If each bracelet uses 12 beads, how many bracelets can the beader make?

Mountain Peak, the famous company for manufacturing bicycles, produces a new model of bicycles every year. Currently, they have 63 bicycles ready for sale. If each gear of the new model can sell exactly 7 bicycles, how many gears are there in the new model of the bicycle?
A contractor has 80 windows to fit into houses. If each house requires 8 windows, how many houses can the contractor completely outfit with window fittings?
A compass maker sells 12 compasses each day for a certain number of days. After a while, he has sold a total of 84 compasses. How many days did it take to sell this many compasses?
A new computer lab at a school has 3 computers per row. If there are 7 rows in total, how many computers are there in the computer lab?
A painter has 4 cups of yellow paint. If he uses those 4 cups to paint at a rate of 1 cup per large wall, how many large walls can he paint?
In a lemon farm, each tree produces lemons in a consistent way. If 6 trees can produce 60 lemons in total, how many lemons does each tree, on average, produce?
In a library, there are 9 books that form a complete series. If each book in the series corresponds to 1 complete story, how many stories are in the series?
A clothing factory has 6 yards of fabric to make shirts. Each shirt requires 3 yards of fabric. How many shirts can the factory make?
There are 24 train compartments in a train. Each train car consists of 8 compartments. How many cars does the train have?
A clothing factory produces pants and is currently working on 32 pairs. Each rack in the factory can hold 8 pairs of pants. How many racks are being used to hold all the pants?

A contractor is designing a large window for a client. The window is to be separated into smaller square panes. If each square pane has 9 square inches of glass and total square inches of glass used for the large window is 36, what is the number of square panes in the window?
Granny loves to knit blankets for her grandchildren. She uses 12 balls of yarn for each blanket. If Granny has 72 balls of yarn, how many blankets can she knit?

A dairy farm produces milk packets. Each day, it produces 3 times the amount of milk packets it produced on the previous day. If on the third day, it produced 33 milk packets, how many milk packets did it produce on the second day?

A helicopter company has a policy of ensuring that each of their helicopters gets 10 hours of maintenance for every time it's used. If a particular helicopter has had 70 hours of maintenance, how many times has it been used?
There are 6 elephants in the zoo and they are divided into different habitats. If each habitat has 2 elephants, how many habitats are there in the zoo?
A dolphin can jump 5 times in a single minute. If a dolphin continuously jumps for 'p' minutes, it can jump 60 times. How many minutes did the dolphin jump for?
In a large forest, there are groups of trees. Each group has 7 trees. If there are 63 trees in total, how many groups of trees are there in the forest?
A hat shop has created 96 new hats to sell. If each style has exactly 12 of the same hat, how many styles does the hat shop have?
In a certain month, it rained consistently every couple of days. If it rained 24 days in total and each period of continuous rain lasted for 8 days, how many periods of rain were there in that month?
In a factory, 6 bottles are manufactured in a single cycle. If the factory has manufactured 48 bottles today, how many cycles of production have been performed?
At a live concert, a singer wants to sing 110 verses to entertain his fans. He decides to divide the verses evenly among 10 songs. How many verses will there be in each song?
In a photography studio, there are 16 cameras that are shared by photographers. If each photographer gets 2 cameras, how many photographers are there in the studio?
At a zoo, a group of 99 penguins need to be separated into different areas so each one has 9 penguins. How many areas are needed to separate all the penguins evenly?

A Piano teacher sets a task to practice specific pieces of music. Each piece takes 3 hours to practice thoroughly. If her student has 9 hours for practice, how many pieces can the student practice thoroughly?

In a pillow factory, 3 pillows can be stitched from a certain amount of fabric. If the fabric used is divided by 6, that results in the number of pillows that can be made from it. How much fabric is used to make these 3 pillows?
A stationery store sells pens in packs. If each pack contains 9 pens, and there are exactly 9 packs, how many pens are in the store?
A tiger has 4 pounds of meat for his meal today. If one serving size is an eighth of a pound, then how many servings are in the tiger's meal?
At a birthday party, there is a long string of 5 meters that is used for tying the balloons. If each balloon requires 1 meter of string to be tied, how many balloons can be tied with this string?

A plane crashed into a deserted island and split into multiple parts. After an investigation, it was found that there were 48 parts in total. If each plane section accounts for 8 parts, how many sections did the plane originally have before the crash?
A farmer has a field full of strawberry plants. He collects 40 strawberries and divides them equally among his friends. If each friend is given 4 strawberries, how many friends does the farmer have?
On a fun fair, a hot chocolate booth sells their beverage for 10 dollars per cup. One day, they manage to earn a total of 70 dollars. How many cups of hot chocolate did they sell?
A jeweler has a certain amount of precious rings. If he sold 5 rings for a total of 35 dollars, how much does each ring cost?

There are 60 lions in a national park. If the park authority decides to evenly distribute these lions into different regions such that each region has exactly 10 lions, how many regions would there be?

For an upcoming clothing sale, a store decides to discount their jackets. After the discount, each jacket costs 6 dollars. If the original price was "d" dollars and it's now 1/5th of its original price, what was the original price of the jacket?
In a zoo, each giraffe eats 7 pounds of food each day. If the total amount of food consumed by the giraffes is 28 pounds today, how many giraffes are there in the zoo?
In a shallow pool, a group of 30 starfish decided to divide themselves equally to live in different zones of the pool. If each zone contains 6 starfish, how many zones are there in total?
An astronaut has 88 hours of oxygen in his tank. If he can use this tank for 8 days, how many hours of oxygen does the tank provide each day?

Steve started with 38 dollars and spent it evenly over 8 days. Then he received an extra 11 dollars. John started with 18 dollars but then he spent the same amount of money as Steve had. John found 25 dollars on the street. How much money does John have now?

In the previous problem, Steve started with 38 dollars and spent it evenly over 8 days. Then he received an extra 11 dollars. John started with 18 dollars but then he spent the same amount of money as Steve had. John found 25 dollars on the street. After a week, John received a bonus at his job and the total became the amount he had plus an extra 38 dollars. How much money does John have now after receiving the bonus?

In the previous problem, Steve started with 38 dollars and spent it evenly over 8 days. Then he received an extra 11 dollars. John had 18 dollars but then he spent the same amount of money as Steve did. John found 25 dollars on the street. What if this time, Steve bought a scratch-off lottery ticket and only won a total of 38 dollars, which he decided to divide amongst 41 of his friends? Under this new circumstance, how much money would John have after finding the same 25 dollars on the street and spending the same amount of money as Steve did?
You have $45 in your wallet. You find a coin on the street worth $27/30. How much money do you have in total?
After picking up the coin worth $27/30, you find another pile of coins. This pile of coins is worth $5/36. How much money do you have in total now?
Instead of finding a coin worth $27/30, you actually found a coin worth $43/30 when you went to the currency exchange. Now, how much money do you have in total?
John has $17 in his bank account. He finds a loose change on his desk that amounts to $8/37. How much money does he have in total?

After totaling his money, John decides to save more by doing some extra tasks. He earns $22 per task. If he completes a number of tasks equal to the total money he currently has, how much money will he have then?

John initially thought he had $17 in his bank account. However, he recently discovered that he actually had $7 instead. If he still has the same amount of loose change amounting to $8/37 on his desk, what is his new total amount of money?

Sally wants to measure the distance of her bike route. Initially, she hesitates and travels only 47/50 of a mile. Then, she gains confidence and rides another 31 miles. Every day for the next 28 days, she completes the same distance.

One day, she decided to detour and added an extra 32/24 miles to her regular bike route. How many miles in total did she travel after adding the extra traveling distance?

In the previous problem, Sally initially hesitated and traveled only 47/50 of a mile before gaining confidence and biking 31 miles each day. 

But what if we consider a scenario where Sally initially traveled a slightly longer distance before gaining confidence? Instead of 47/50 of a mile, she managed to cover 47/42 of a mile in her hesitant stage. Like before, she then rides 31 more miles after gaining confidence and continues this same distance every day for the next 28 days.

On the day when she decided to detour, she still added an extra 32/24 miles to her regular bike route.

In this scenario, how many miles in total did she travel after adding the extra traveling distance?
A train travels at a steady speed of 47 miles per hour for 4 hours. How far does the train travel in that time?
If instead of traveling for 4 hours initially, the train had traveled for 18 hours at the same speed of 47 miles per hour, how far would the train have traveled in that time?

A truck can travel a distance of 34/25 kilometers on a liter of fuel. If 11 more kilometers are added to its journey, what is the total distance the truck can travel before running out of fuel? Then, if an additional 49 kilometers are added to the journey, what would be the total distance then?

Instead of the previous scenario, now consider that the truck can travel a distance of 30 kilometers more than the distance it can cover on one liter of fuel which is 34/25 kilometers. If an additional 49 kilometers are then added to the journey, what would be the total distance then?

John drank a special energy drink that increased his jogging speed. After the energy drink, he was able to jog 50/49 miles per hour faster. A truck driver starts his route with 9 gallons of gas in his tank. He stops at a station and adds to this tank another 21/36 gallons of gas. Later, he stops at another station and adds another 26/42 gallons of gas. How many gallons of gas total does the truck driver have now in his tank?

In the previous problem the truck driver has just reached his final total of gasoline in his tank. Now, suppose that his truck uses up this fuel at a rate by which each gallon lasts for 35 miles. How far can he continue to drive with the total amount of gasoline he has in his tank?

Suppose now we mistakenly thought that the second stop was dispensing fuel faster and he actually added 26/4 gallons instead of 26/42 gallons in the second stop. If he still had the original 9 gallons to start with and added the 21/36 gallons in the first stop as per the original scenario, how much fuel would the truck driver have now in his truck after making both stops?
John has 6 dollars in his pocket. He then earns an additional 47/8 dollars from mowing his neighbor's lawn. How much money does he now have in total?

Suppose Sally didn't make 63 pairs of socks, but she actually only made 9 pairs of socks initially. She still added 6 more pairs of socks the next day as she did previously. How many pairs of socks does Sally have now?

Mike is the owner of an aquarium. He added 13 gallons of water to one of his tanks in the morning. Later in the afternoon, he added another 55 gallons to the same tank. Meanwhile, in another tank, he added 57 gallons in the morning and an additional 33 gallons in the afternoon. What is the total quantity of water (in gallons) that Mike added to both of his tanks throughout the day?

Now, imagine that Mike also has a large pond outside his house. In the evening, he decides to refill it and adds 56 gallons of water. Considering all three locations (the two tanks and the pond), how much total water did Mike add throughout the day?

Let's reconsider the scenario. Instead of adding 55 gallons of water to his first tank, suppose Mike instead adds 96 gallons of water in the afternoon. Given that all other quantities remain the same with 13 gallons added in the morning to the first tank, and the second tank receiving 57 gallons in the morning and an additional 33 gallons in the afternoon, how much total water did Mike add to both tanks throughout the day?

Teddy has a favorite toy which is a tiny teddy bear. One day, Teddy's dad gave him 64 more teddy bears. Teddy's mom, feeling envious, gave Teddy 60 more teddy bears plus the exact number of teddy bears Teddy's dad gave him. At the end of the day, Teddy's grandma surprised him with twice the number of teddy bears his mom gave him. How many teddy bears did Teddy receive from his grandma?

Let's imagine that instead of 64 teddy bears, Teddy's dad initially gave him only 30 teddy bears. Teddy's mom, feeling envious as before, gave Teddy 60 more bears plus the exact number of bears Teddy's dad gave him. At the end of the day, Teddy's grandma, wanting to double the joy, surprised him with twice the number of teddy bears his mom gave him. How many teddy bears did Teddy receive from his grandma under this new scenario?
In a forest, there are 84 oak trees. If the number of pine trees adds 75 more to the total number of trees, how many trees are there in the forest?
Continuing from the previous question, suppose that the forest officials plant an additional 68 maple trees in the forest. Now how many trees are there overall in the forest?

In retrospect, considering the number of oak trees in the forest, it was mistaken before. There are actually 84 oak trees, not including other types of trees. If the number of pine trees adds 27 more to the total number of trees, how many trees are there in the forest now?
In a newly discovered dinosaur park, scientists found 71 Neovenator dinosaurs and 56 Ferrotholus dinosaurs. How many total dinosaurs did they find in all?

After their initial discovery at the dinosaur park, scientists found another group of dinosaurs which was equal to the total number of Neovenator and Ferrotholus dinosaurs combined. How many dinosaurs did the scientists find in this second group?

In their initial findings, the scientists had made a miscount and actually found 54 Neovenator dinosaurs instead of 71. With the same number of Ferrotholus dinosaurs being 56, what is the corrected total number of dinosaurs they found?

A boat has traveled 88 miles today. The next day, it travels 92 more miles plus the miles it traveled today. The third day, it travels an additional 61 miles plus the miles it traveled the previous days. How many miles has the boat traveled in these three days?

After traveling for three days, the boat continues its journey. On the fourth day, it travels an additional 78 miles plus the miles it traveled in the previous three days. How many miles has the boat traveled in total over these four days?

In the previous scenario, suppose that on the second day, the boat had traveled only 37 miles instead of 92, in addition to the miles it traveled on the first day. The boat continued to travel 61 miles plus the previous day's on the third day as before. How many miles has the boat traveled in these three days under this new scenario?
Sarah has 7 liters of apple juice. She went to the store and bought 69 more liters. How many liters of apple juice does Sarah have now?

Initially, Sarah thought she had bought only 7 liters of juice, but she realized she had actually bought 55 liters of apple juice. If she still bought an additional 69 liters from the store, how much apple juice does Sarah have in total now?

Sally is on a mission to build the biggest marshmallow tower. She starts with 83 marshmallows, but then her friend brings an additional 33 marshmallows. How many marshmallows does Sally have now for her tower?
After Sally counts all her marshmallows, her other friend decides to contribute as well and brings 22 more marshmallows. How many marshmallows does Sally have in total now for her tower?
Suppose Sally started with only 13 marshmallows instead of 83 and then her friend brought the same amount of 33 additional marshmallows. How many marshmallows would Sally have had then for her tower?

Jenna is a jewelry maker. She currently has 48 earrings in stock. She makes an additional 34 earrings for a special event. After the event, Jenna makes 24 more earrings to replenish her stock. How many earrings does she have in total?
After the special event, Jenna decides to replenish her stock by making 94 more earrings instead of the 24 she initially planned. Now, how many earrings does she have on her shelf?
In a city, 48 babies were born in March, and in April, another 25 were born. How many babies were born in these two months in total?
In May, the number of babies born matches the total of both March and April. How many babies were born in May?
In a rethink, the hospital realized that there were actually 55 babies born in March, not 48. With the 25 born in April, how many babies were born in total over the two months?

At a drum store, there are 52 drum sets on display and 1 more drum set in the store room. In a different section of the same store, there are also 46 single drums. How many total drums and drum sets are in the store?

Suppose in the store, instead of having 52 drum sets, there were only 52 single drums, in addition to the 1 drum set in the store room. Given that there are still 46 single drums in a different section, how many drums and drum sets are then in the store?

A store sells 9 boxes of oranges each day. The following day, the seller added 22 more boxes to the total from the previous day. The next day, he added another 26 boxes to that day's total. How many boxes of oranges does the store have on the last day?

Following on from the problem with the orange seller: after the seller added 26 boxes to the previous day's total, he decided to get a major shipment of oranges. So, he added an impressive shipment of 96 more boxes to the pile. Now, how many boxes of oranges does the store have?

Following on from the previous scenario with the orange seller: suppose that the seller initially had only 9 boxes of orange but on the subsequent day, he added 22 new boxes as before. However, instead of adding 26 boxes to total on the third day this time, he adds 66 boxes. How many boxes of oranges does the store have now?
Yvonne has 27 balls in her collection. She went to a fair and won 19 more. How many balls does Yvonne have in her collection now?
After donating some of her balls, Yvonne now has 97 balls left in her collection. She goes to another fair and wins 19 more. How many balls does Yvonne have in her collection now?
In the sky, a cloud split into 8 small clouds and 13 larger ones. Another cloud split the same way. How many total clouds were formed?
After splitting, the original clouds came back together and formed 91 additional smaller clouds. How many total clouds are there now including the additional smaller clouds formed?

What if initially, instead of splitting into 8 small clouds, each of the two clouds split into 43 small clouds and kept the 13 larger ones the same? How many total clouds would have formed in that case?

Oliver recently took up skateboard stunting. He can perform 77 stunts with his skateboard. Now, if he learns to perform each stunt in reverse as well, how many stunts will he be able to perform in total?

Following his initial success, Oliver spends a few more months and learns 27 additional new skateboard stunts. Now, including his ability to perform the original stunts in reverse, how many skateboard stunts can Oliver perform in total?

After learning from his experience, Oliver realizes that he initially only needed to learn 61 stunts, as he could perform each stunt in reverse to effectively create a new trick. If he is still able to perform each of these stunts in reverse, how many skateboard stunts can Oliver perform now?

A pair of binoculars increases visibility by 22 degrees in one direction and 26 degrees in another direction. What is the total increase in the angle of visibility when both directions are considered?

Continuing from the previous problem, after the binoculars increase visibility by 22 degrees in one direction and 26 degrees in another direction, an additional lens is added that further increases the visibility by 76 degrees. What is the total increase in the angle of visibility considering all enhancements?

Continuing from the previous problem, consider that the binoculars initially increased visibility by 14 degrees in one direction instead of 22 degrees, while the increase in the other direction remains 26 degrees. What is the total increase in the angle of visibility now when both directions are considered?

In a galaxy, there are 83 stars in the Great Nebula. Fifty more are spotted in the South Nebula. In the Eastern Nebula, there are 45 stars. How many stars are there in total in the Great Nebula, South Nebula, and Eastern Nebula?

Following from the previous problem, a recalculation by astronomers reveals that there are actually 32 stars, not 83, in the Great Nebula. Considering this recalculation, with 50 stars still in the South Nebula, and 45 in the Eastern Nebula, how many stars are there now across these three nebulas?
A boy has 15 balls. He goes to the store and buys another 22 balls. How many balls does he have now?
In addition to the balls he already has, his friends give him 64 more balls for his upcoming birthday. Now, how many balls does the boy have in total?
Consider instead that the boy originally had 48 balls instead of 15. After buying another 22 balls from the store, how many balls does he have now?
Mira has 82 beautiful roses in her garden, and she decides to plant 12 additional daisies to add more variety. How many flowers does Mira have in her garden after planting the daisies?
Suppose instead Mira originally had 88 roses in her garden before planting the 12 daisies. How many flowers would there be in Mira's garden then?
A jeweler strings together 82 gems to begin making a bracelet. He then adds 79 more gems to it. He finishes off the bracelet by adding 58 more gems. How many gems are there in total on the bracelet?

Following the previous problem: after the jeweler has strung together the number of gems on the bracelet, he decides to make a matching necklace. He adds another 60 gems to the total number of gems he has already used. How many gems in total did the jeweler use for both the bracelet and the necklace?

The jeweler has a change of mind and decides to start recreating the bracelet, but this time he starts with 77 gems instead of 82. He once again adds 79 more gems and completes it by adding 58 more gems. How many gems are now on this new bracelet in total?
Dalia has a stock of 65 tomatoes. She decides to buy the same quantity again. How many tomatoes does she have now?
After buying the same quantity of tomatoes again, Dalia decides to buy 50 more from her friend's farm. How many tomatoes does she have in total now?

After seeing how her tomato stock fared last time, Dalia decides to start with 89 tomatoes this time. She decides again to buy the same quantity from her supplier. How many tomatoes does she have in stock now?
David has 25 pens in his pencil case. His best friend Pam gives him 34 more pens as a gift. How many pens does David have now?

David decided to count his pens to make sure he knows how many he has. When counting, he realizes he has as many pens as the total of the 25 pens in his pencil case and the 34 pens Pam gave him. How many pens does David count?
David rechecks his pencil case and realizes he made a mistake. He actually had 55 pens in his pencil case, not 25. If Pam still gave him 34 pens, how many pens does David have now?

A clothing designer is creating a custom shirt. The length of the shirt is 86 cm. The chest measurement is the length added by 11 cm. The waist measurement is the same as the sum of the two chest measurements. What is the waist measurement of the shirt in cm?

The clothing designer decides to adjust the shirt after taking the initial measurements. To ensure a comfortable fit, the designer adds a further 9 cm to the final waist measurement, which was the same as the sum of the two chest measurements. What is the new adjusted waist measurement of the shirt in cm?

The waist measurement is set as the sum of the two chest measurements. What is the waist measurement of this new shirt design in cm?
The computer has an initial operating power of 96 Watts. Later, an update increases the operational power by an additional 84 Watts. What is the computer's operation power after the update?

Suppose that the computer initially had an operating power of 36 Watts instead of 96 Watts. Then, the same update increases the operational power by an additional 84 Watts. How much operation power would the computer have after the update in this scenario?

A company produces 62 tubes of toothpaste every hour at their plant. Later, the company upgrades their production capacity and is now able to make 40 more tubes every hour. How many tubes of toothpaste can the company produce per hour after the upgrade?

Suppose the company initially started with a production capacity of 75 tubes of toothpaste every hour instead of 62. After the first upgrade, which still added an additional 40 tubes of toothpaste to their hour production, how many toothpaste tubes can the company produce per hour?

At the beginning of the month, a penguin had 31 fish. By the middle of the month, he had as many fish as the initial amount plus 31 more. At the end of the month, he had as many fish as the amount he had in the middle of the month and the initial 31 fish. How many fish did the penguin have at the end of the month?

Let's reconsider the original scenario with the penguin. Instead of getting the original 31 extra fish in the middle of the month, the penguin now only gets an additional 21 fish. Using the rest of the fish count as before, how many fish does the penguin have by the end of the month now?
Katie baked 34 cookies in the morning. She baked the same amount in the afternoon. How many cookies did Katie bake in total?

Continuing from the previous problem, what if instead of making 34 cookies in the morning and afternoon, Katie actually baked 23 cookies during each time period? How many cookies did she make in total in that case?
Emma bought 17 toothbrushes for her family. Her friend Clarissa then gave her an additional sum of 71 and 38 toothbrushes from her dentist's office. How many toothbrushes does Emma have now?
Emma then visited a local health fair where she received an additional 59 toothbrushes to add to her collection. How many toothbrushes does Emma now have in total?

In the previous problem, suppose Emma initially bought 17 toothbrushes. But this time, Clarissa gives her an additional sum of 80 and 38 toothbrushes instead of the previous amount she received. How many toothbrushes does Emma have now?
A frog is sitting on a leaf. The leaf is 31 cm from the ground. The frog jumps and reaches an exact same spot on another leaf. How much distance in centimeters did the frog cover in total?

After jumping to another leaf, the frog decided to jump again to a flower that is 69 cm above from the ground. Considering the distance the frog covered in his previous jumps, how much distance in centimeters did the frog cover in total?

Suppose instead of the initial 31 cm, the leaves were only 20 cm above the ground when the frog first started jumping. Given the same jumps as before, how much distance in centimeters would the frog cover then?

In a summer vacation assignment, Olivia wrote 70 words on her first day and 23 words on the second day. In addition to this, Isabella wrote 17 words in her assignment. Find the total number of words written by both Olivia and Isabella.

Now imagine that after Olivia and Isabella completed their assignments, Isabella decided to write an additional 17 words. With this additional contribution, what is the total number of words written by both Olivia and Isabella?

In the previous scenario, consider now that Olivia initially wrote only 4 words on the first day instead of 70, but still wrote 23 words on the second day. Isabella wrote 17 words as before. Given this, how many total words have Olivia and Isabella written now?
On a morning commute, a bus picks up 48 riders at one stop. At the next stop, it picks up another 18 riders. How many riders are there in all on the bus?

After the morning commute, the same bus does an afternoon route. The number of riders it picks up is exactly the same as the morning route. How many riders does the bus pick up in total for both the morning and afternoon routes?
In a new scenario, the bus picks up 48 riders on the morning commute, just like before. But this time at the next stop, it picks up 52 more riders. How many riders are there in all on the bus now?

Sophia found a box of old trading cards in the attic. She counted 24 of them as baseball cards and 35 as basketball cards. Later on, she discovered 22 more cards from various sports. How many trading cards has Sophia found in total?

After Sophia counted 24 baseball cards, 35 basketball cards, and another 22 cards from various sports that she had found in the attic, she remembered her old shoebox full of trading cards under her bed. In the shoebox, she found 45 more cards. How many total trading cards does Sophia have now?

Sophia initially found 24 baseball cards and 35 basketball cards in the attic. Later, she discovered 92 more cards, making it a wide variety of sports cards. How many trading cards has Sophia found in total now?

For his birthday, Jenny's father receives 16 gifts. Eight more gifts arrive in the mail the next day. In addition, Jenny's dad gets 23 gifts at his office. How many gifts did Jenny's dad receive in total?

What if Jenny had made a mistake in her original count and her dad actually received 38 gifts initially, not 16? Eight more gifts still arrive in the mail the next day and he still gets the 23 gifts at his office. With these changes, how many gifts did Jenny's dad receive in total now?
Let's say you have 30 pencils. You bought an exact same amount more. How many pencils do you have now?
After buying the same amount of additional pencils, you find that your friend has gifted you 15 more pencils. How many pencils do you have in total now?
Let's consider the previous scenario but this time, you initially have 80 pencils instead of 30. If you again bought an exact same amount more, how many pencils would you have now?
Peter watched 93 minutes of TV in the morning. Later in the evening, he watched another 84 minutes. How many total minutes of TV did Peter watch in a day?

Continuing from the last time, after Peter had watched a total of minutes from morning and the evening, he again watched an additional 92 minutes of TV before his bedtime. How many total minutes of TV did Peter watch now in the whole day?
Suppose instead of 93 minutes in the morning, Peter initially watched 83 minutes of TV. He still watched 84 minutes later in the evening. Now, how many total minutes of TV did Peter watch in a day?
Jake has 69 balls. He goes to a store and buys the same amount of balls. How many balls does Jake have now?
Following up on the previous problem, after Jake buys the same amount of balls from the store, his friend decides to give him an additional 12 balls as a gift. How many balls does Jake have now?

Continuing from the previous problem, let's say Jake initially bought only 54 balls instead of 69. He still doubles that amount by buying the same number of balls from the store. How many balls would Jake have then?

A zookeeper takes count of the elephants in the zoo. In the first section, he finds 53 elephants. In the next section, he finds 71 more. On his way out, he realizes that he needs to revisit a previously counted section of 72 elephants. How many elephants did he count altogether?

After the zookeeper's day shift, he decides to check the recorded count of the elephants during his night shift. He revisits the first two sections counting 53 and 71 elephants and recounts the same number. He then adds this to his previous total count including the section with the 72 elephants. What is his total count of the elephants now after his night shift?
Sally is organizing her wardrobe and she notices she has a total of 7 dresses and 96 skirts. Later, she also finds another 26 shirts. How many total items of clothing does Sally have in her wardrobe?

After going through her wardrobe again, Sally realizes she actually has 99 skirts instead of 96. Keeping the count of 7 dresses and 26 shirts the same, how many total items of clothing does Sally have in her wardrobe now?

Sarah has managed to bake 80 sandwiches for the local fundraiser. Later in the day, Kevin, her friend, comes over and makes an additional quantity of sandwiches such that in total, the sandwiches he makes added to Sarah's make up 33 more than the number of sandwiches made by Sarah. How many sandwiches did Kevin make?

Earlier, we mentioned that Kevin had made 33 sandwiches more than what Sarah initially did. However, let's consider a situation where Sarah actually started by baking 95 sandwiches for the local fundraiser instead. In this new scenario, how many sandwiches would Kevin have made so that the total sandwiches he makes and those made by Sarah still yield the same differential of 33?
Gabriella has 31 grapes. She buys 75 more. John has 64 grapes and decides to add to his pile all the grapes that Gabriella has. How many grapes does John have now?

Instead of buying 75 grapes, what if Gabriella had bought 45 grapes initially. In this scenario, she would start with 31 grapes, then buy an additional 45 grapes, and then John would take his 64 grapes and add all the grapes Gabriella has. How many grapes would John have then?
A queen bee lays 51 eggs and then lays an additional 64 eggs. The worker bees find 53 more eggs in the hive, and then they discover another cache of 79 eggs. How many eggs are in the hive in total?
Following the discovery of the cache of 79 eggs in the hive, an experienced beekeeper gives the worker bees a batch of 5 eggs from another hive. How many eggs are in the hive now?
A fruit vendor sells 68 bananas in a day. Meanwhile, a small market nearby sells 35 bananas during the same day. How many bananas were sold in total that day?

From the bananas sold in a day, a fruit vendor picks up the total number of bananas he and the nearby small market have sold. This number is noted down for record keeping. What is the recorded total number of bananas sold in a day?

Earlier, the fruit vendor sold 68 bananas in a day, but the following day he sells only 49 bananas. The same small market nearby keeps its sales consistent and sells 35 bananas again. How many bananas were sold in total on this new day?
Sam's computer has 23GB of storage space left. After compressing some files, he is able to free up an additional 98GB. How much total storage space does Sam's computer have now?

Now, suppose Sam had originally had a total of 96GB of storage space available on his computer instead of 23GB. After compressing the same files, he is still able to free up an additional 98GB. With this scenario, how much total storage space does Sam's computer have now?
Frank has a fish farm with 77 fish in one of the tanks. One day, he decides to add an additional 19 fish into the tank. How many fish are there in the tank in total?
Frank continues to grow his fish farm and adds an additional 51 fish into the tank. Now, how many fish are there in the tank in total?

Following up on the previous question, imagine Frank started with a smaller tank that only had 4 fish. He adds the same number of fish as before, an additional 19 into the tank. How many fish are now in that tank in total?

A truck driver starts his journey with 83 gallons of gas in his tank. He stops at the first station and fills up an additional 36 gallons. Then he drives until he needs to refill and adds 99 more gallons. Finally, he stops near his destination and tops off his tank with 7 gallons. How many total gallons of gas did the truck driver use for his journey?

Instead of topping off his tank with 7 gallons near his destination as in the initial journey, the truck driver decides to fill up 39 gallons this time. With this change, how many total gallons of gas did the truck driver use for his journey?

Bobby goes to the local park and decides to test how high he can swing on three different swings. On the first swing, he goes 56 feet in the air, then comes back down and goes another 53 feet high. On the second swing, he goes as high as he did on the first one plus an additional 5 feet. On the third swing, he challenges himself and goes as high as he did on the second one plus an additional 34 feet. How high did Bobby swing on the third swing?

Thrilled with his success on the first three swings, Bobby decides to attempt a final swing. This time, he pushes himself to go as high as he did on the third swing plus an additional 69 feet. How high did Bobby swing on this final powerhouse swing?

Bob starts with a wallet containing $88. He finds $40 on the ground and adds it to his wallet. Later, his mom gives him an additional $56 for doing chores. How much money does Bob have in his wallet now?
In addition to the money Bob has in his wallet, his sister Penny gives him $13 from her piggy bank to help him buy a new game. How much money does Bob have now?

Instead of finding $40 on the ground, Bob initially finds $53. He adds this to his original $88 he had in the wallet, and his mom still gives him an additional $56 for doing chores. How much money does Bob have in his wallet now?

In a magical wizard world, Eugene the wizard has 98 magic orbs. Merlin, another wizard, has 71 more orbs than Eugene. Damien, a third wizard, has 59 orbs more than Merlin. How many orbs does Damien have?
In the further adventures of our magical wizards, Gertrude, a wise wizard, acquires 90 orbs more than Damien. How many orbs does Gertrude have now?

Emma has 5 dolls. Sophia gives her the same number of dolls as she already has. How many dolls does Emma have now?

During a chilly winter, Sally makes a hot chocolate recipe that requires 36 spoons of chocolate and 84 spoons of milk. After she adds the chocolate and milk, she also adds 34 spoons of whipped cream. How many total spoons of ingredients does Sally use for her hot chocolate?

Continuing from the previous problem, what if Sally decided to increase her hot chocolate formula by using 64 spoons of chocolate instead of 36, while keeping the amount of milk and whipped cream identical. How many total spoons of ingredients does Sally now use for her hot chocolate recipe?
In a word game, the letter Z is given a score of 3. The score of the letter U is the sum of 31 and the score of Z. What is the score of the letter U?

Mathew has 81 ounces of apple juice. He wants to add some orange juice to it. So, he pours in another 99 ounces. After pouring the orange juice, how many ounces of juice does Mathew have overall?

Carla is testing a new feature on her binoculars that allows her to see objects from greater distances. Initially, she sets the view distance at 91 meters. Then, she increases the view distance by 80 more meters. What is the new adjusted viewing distance on her binoculars?

Carla is now even more interested and decides to push her new binoculars to their limits. She decides to add another 92 meters to the viewing distance on her binoculars. After making this additional adjustment, what is the total viewing distance on Carla's binoculars now?

Bobby has 42 keys. He gets another set of keys that has 56 more than the original set. Bobby also has a keychain that includes both the original set of keys and the new set of keys. How many keys does Bobby have in total?

Jordy has 45 carrots. She manages to gather the same amount again from her farm. How many carrots does Jordy have now?

In a painting competition, one artist uses 43 blue strokes and 53 red strokes to complete his painting. Another artist, inspired by the first one, decides to use 67 more strokes in addition to what the first artist used. A third artist doubles the total number of strokes used by the second artist for her painting. How many strokes did the third artist use in her painting?

You buy 42 ice cream cones for your friends. You then decide to buy the same amount for another group of friends. How many ice cream cones did you buy in total?

Mike's left binocular lens can magnify objects from a distance of 30 miles away, and the right lens can magnify objects that are 56 miles away. He also has a telescope that can magnify objects from a distance of 67 miles away. What is the total distance from which both his binoculars and telescope can magnify objects?

In the land of the Wizarding World, one wand spells costs 50 magical crystals known as Quiblets. Quintus the wizard adds 5 Quiblets more to this to cast a slightly stronger spell. This amount is then topped up by 25 magical Quiblets to cast the most powerful spell. How many Quiblets does Quintus the wizard need to cast the most powerful spell?

Paul has 2 bicycles and he bought 1 more. Later, his grandfather gave him an additional 2 bikes. How many bikes does Paul have now?

Instead of hitting the first note every 17/17 seconds, the drummer decides to change the beat and hit it every 16/17 seconds. They're still hitting the second note every 2/12 seconds though. How long does it now take the drummer to hit the two beats together?
If a fireplace burns 12/17 cord of wood in the morning and 8/19 cord in the evening, what is the total cord of wood it burns in a day?
In addition to the wood burned throughout the day, the fireplace burns an additional 19/20 cord of wood at night. What is the total cord of wood the fireplace burns in one full day?
A butterfly's flight consisted of two segments. The first segment was 18/19 of a mile and the second was 9/17 of a mile. How long was the entire flight?
After completing the first two segments of its flight, the butterfly flies an additional 19/20 of a mile. What is the total distance now that the butterfly has flown?

Suppose the butterfly's first flight segment was actually shorter than previously thought, only 18/12 of a mile instead of 18/19 of a mile, while the second segment remained 9/17 of a mile. What would be the new total length of the butterfly's flight?

While measuring a map, Jenna finds that the distance between two cities is 13/10 inches, and the distance from the second city to the third city is 14/15 inches. What is the total distance Jenna measured between the three cities on the map?

Instead of the distance between the first two cities on the map being 13/10 inches, suppose it is 13/7 inches. Keeping the distance from the second city to the third city the same at 14/15 inches, what would then be the total distance between the three cities on the map?
A helium balloon rises at a rate of 13/6 feet per second. After a gust of wind, its speed increases by 3/16 feet per second. What is the new speed of the balloon in feet per second?
If a second identical helium balloon behaving exactly like the first one rises alongside, what would be their total combined speed in feet per second?
Scarlett has 16/10 gallons of red paint. If she uses 1/20 of a gallon for a small art project, how many gallons of red paint will she have left?
After finishing the small art project, Scarlett decides to mix the remaining red paint with 5/7 gallons of yellow paint to make orange paint. How many gallons of paint does she have now?
Suppose Scarlett initially had 16/10 gallons of red paint. But this time, she uses 2/20 of a gallon for her small project instead. How many gallons of red paint does she have left now?
Susie has a box of 12 chocolate bars. She decides to eat 2/5 of a chocolate bar herself. How many chocolate bars are left in the box?

Susie has a box of 12 chocolate bars. She decides to eat 2/5 of a chocolate bar herself. Then, her friend Lucy takes a further 19/11 chocolate bars. How many chocolate bars are left in the box after Lucy takes some?
Let's reconsider the scenario: Susie has a box of 12 chocolate bars. But this time, she decides to eat 2/13 of a chocolate bar herself instead of 2/5. How many chocolate bars are left in the box?
A plane is flying at an altitude of 2 miles, then it descends by 10/15 of a mile. What is the new altitude of the plane?
What if the plane initially flew at a lower altitude, only 2 miles high, before it descended 12/15 of a mile? What would be the altitude of the plane after this descent?
A child goes down a slide that's 6/19 meters long, and then goes down another slide that's 17/4 meters long. How many total meters did they slide?

If originally, the first slide was actually 6/5 meters long instead of 6/19 meters long, and the child goes down this slide and then another slide that's 17/4 meters long, how many total meters did they slide?

A colonial fireplace burns firewood at a rate of 4/15 cords per hour in the early morning. In the late night, the rate increases to 14/15 cords per hour. How much firewood does the fireplace burn in total in one hour split between the early morning and late night?

If the colonial fireplace burns firewood at a combined rate of 4/15 cords per hour in the early morning and 14/15 cords per hour in the late night, and during the peak hours, it burns an additional 6/5 cords per hour. Then how much total firewood does the fireplace burn in one hour considering early morning, late night, and peak hours?

Continuing from the previous scenario, let's suppose the colonial fireplace in the early morning burns firewood at a slightly different rate of 8/15 cords per hour instead of 4/15 cords per hour.  The late night burning rate remains the same at 14/15 cords per hour. Given these new circumstances, how much firewood does the fireplace burn in total in one hour split between the early morning and late night?
An alien travelled 9/20 of a light year towards earth then decided to move forward another 11/7 light years. How many light years has the alien travelled in total?
After traveling ((9 / 20) + (11 / 7)) light years towards earth, the alien continues its journey for an additional 14/2 light years. How many light years in total has the alien traveled?

The alien originally travelled ((9 / 20) + (11 / 7)) light years towards earth. But what if instead, the alien had only travelled (9 / 20) + (11 / 11) light years to start with? How many light years would the alien have travelled then?
If Bob has 10/2 of a cucumber and he adds it to 1/7 of another cucumber, how many cucumbers does he have in total?
After combining the cucumbers, Bob duplicates his total amount. Now, how many cucumbers does he have?
Suppose instead of 1/7 of a cucumber, Bob initially has 17/7 (or about 2 and a half) cucumbers before adding 10/2. How many cucumbers does he have now?
